description: Traffic on New York City’s busiest streets dropped by 7.5% and morning travel times fell on most major crossings into Manhattan during the first work week of the city’s congestion pricing plan, signaling that some motorists changed their driving patterns to avoid the new toll.
title: NYC’s New Congestion Pricing Zone Sees 7.5% Drop in Traffic

description: Chile’s lower house approved a bill to expand electricity subsidies for lower-income families after stripping out a measure that would have raised part of the funds required by curbing profits in a segment of the renewable energy industry.
title: Chile Sidesteps Renewables Profit Grab in Advancing Subsidy Bill

description: As deadly wildfires continue to rage in Los Angeles, a Republican congressman from Texas says federal lawmakers will consider tying relief funding for California to policy changes in the state.
title: Texas Lawmaker Sees California Fire Aid Tied to Policy Changes

description: Senator Marco Rubio is Donald Trump’s nominee to be secretary of state, but in the weeks running up to Inauguration Day, the president-elect’s special envoys have been getting most of the attention.
title: Rubio’s Authority as Secretary of State Threatened Even Before Trump Term Begins

description: Members of President-elect Donald Trump’s incoming economic team are discussing slowly ramping up tariffs month by month, a gradual approach aimed at boosting negotiating leverage while helping avoid a spike in inflation, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump Team Studies Gradual Tariff Hikes Under Emergency Powers

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Steven T. Dennis previews the busy week of confirmation hearings for Donald Trump’s cabinet picks. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Defense Pick Hegseth on Hot Seat as Confirmation Hearings Begin

description: Pete Hegseth, President-elect Donald Trump’s choice to run the Pentagon, earned more than $6 million over the last two years thanks to income as a Fox News host, book royalties and speaking fees, according to his financial disclosure statement.
title: Hegseth Earned $6 Million in Two Years From Fox, Books and Speeches

description: President Joe Biden touted his foreign-policy accomplishments in a speech aimed at burnishing his legacy before he departs office next week, arguing that his actions over the last four years leave the US in a stronger position for President-elect Donald Trump.
title: Biden’s Says He’s Leaving US Stronger in Foreign Policy Farewell

description: President-elect Donald Trump is likely to maintain new US limits on global sales of AI chips by Nvidia Corp. and others, a top Biden administration official said, citing bipartisan national security concerns surrounding China’s pursuit of advanced technology.
title: Trump Likely to Maintain New AI Chip Controls, Top Biden Aide Sullivan Says

description: South Korea will begin a trial on Tuesday to decide if President Yoon Suk Yeol will be permanently removed from office after his shocking martial law declaration.
title: South Korea to Begin Impeachment Trial to Decide on Yoon’s Fate

description: Greenland’s prime minister said he will seek a closer relationship with the US, highlighting the Arctic island’s push for independence amid renewed interest from Donald Trump.
title: Greenland Is Ready to Cooperate With Trump, Prime Minister Says

description: After claiming victory in Venezuela’s July presidential election despite evidence to the contrary, the country’s long-time ruler Nicolás Maduro has been sworn in for a third six-year term, prompting further outcry, widespread global condemnation and fresh sanctions.
title: How an Isolated Maduro Still Clings to Power in Venezuela

description: Wally Adeyemo, the number-two official at the Treasury Department, will leave the Biden administration for a role at Columbia University focusing on economic statecraft and energy policy, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Treasury’s Adeyemo Heads to Columbia With Energy-Sanctions Focus

description: The leader of Canada’s most populous province is pitching a “renewed strategic alliance” with the US on critical minerals, as President-elect Donald Trump threatens crippling tariffs on the northern nation.
title: Ontario Pitches Trump on Mining Deals With Tariffs Looming

description: A federal judge in Florida won’t block US Attorney General Merrick Garland from releasing part of the final report on the federal criminal investigations into President-elect Donald Trump.
title: Judge Clears Release of Trump Special Counsel Report on Election

description: Colombia’s government is committed to keeping public debt on a sustainable path and retaining investor confidence, the nation’s new Finance Minister Diego Guevara said.
title: Colombian Finance Chief Says Leftist Leaders Can’t Afford to Scare Away Investors

description: Does the government need something like DOGE to fix how it works?
title: Jennifer Pahlka on Why the US Government Hiring Process Is so Bad

description: Germany is giving its armed forces the ability to shoot down unidentified drones suspected of spying on military bases, industrial facilities and other critical infrastructure, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Germany Authorizes Military to Shoot Down Mysterious Drones

description: Boston Mayor Michelle Wu is attempting to revive a failed effort to ease the burden on homeowners hit with double-digit increases in their property taxes.
title: Boston Mayor Revives Push for Homeowner Tax Relief as Bills Jump

description: Donald Trump Jr. has taken on a role advising prediction market Kalshi, casting the betting site and others like it as a superior source of assessing the state of politics and elections.
title: Donald Trump Jr. Joins Kalshi and Hypes Market for Election Bets

description: President Joe Biden moved to discharge federal student loans for more than 150,000 people on Monday, in a final push that will bring the total number of borrowers who received loan forgiveness under his administration to over 5 million people.
title: Student Loan Borrowers Aided by Biden Debt Relief Tops 5 Million

description: Billionaire Bill Ackman said he’s supporting former hedge fund manager Whitney Tilson in the crowded Democratic primary for mayor of New York City.
title: Ackman Backs Ex-Hedge Fund Manager Tilson in NYC Mayoral Race

description: Canadians should be prepared to face US tariffs once Donald Trump assumes the presidency next week, with no exemptions for oil, Alberta Premier Danielle Smith warned after meeting the president-elect in Florida.
title: Trump’s Tariffs Are Coming and Will Include Oil, Alberta Premier Warns

description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico invited Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy to hold talks on resuming natural gas transit after a deal between Kyiv and Moscow expired at the start of this year.
title: Slovakia’s Fico Floats Zelenskiy Meeting on Resuming Gas Transit

description: A group of 10 European Union nations is pushing to toughen sanctions against Russia by introducing further restrictions on natural gas and bolstering the enforcement of a price cap on oil.
title: 10 EU Nations Say It’s Time to Sanction Russian Natural Gas, LNG

description: Ireland is looking for allies further east in the European Union to gain more leverage in the bloc at a time when Dublin’s ties with the US are likely to weaken with the incoming Donald Trump administration.
title: Ireland to Bolster Nordic, Baltics Alliance to Gain EU Clout

description: Illinois House Speaker Chris Welch wants to vet the state’s underfunded pensions through a budgetary lens as the legislature looks to close a potentially $3 billion deficit for the year ahead.
title: Illinois House Adds Pension Panel With Budget Shortfalls Growing

description: The US Supreme Court turned away a fresh bid to put independent federal agencies under direct presidential control, as the justices steered clear of a fight with implications for the Federal Trade Commission and Securities and Exchange Commission.
title: Supreme Court Rejects New Bid to Let President Fire Agency Heads

description: The US Supreme Court turned away an appeal by the National Association of Realtors, leaving intact a ruling that lets the Justice Department restart an antitrust probe into the organization’s policies.
title: Realtors Rejected by US Supreme Court on DOJ Antitrust Probe

description: US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said there’s a “distinct possibility” that Israel and Hamas will be able to reach a ceasefire deal before President Joe Biden leaves office in a week.
title: Sullivan Cites ‘Distinct Possibility’ of Gaza Deal This Week

description: For more than a year, Russia has leaned on its increasingly close ally North Korea for supplies of artillery shells and ballistic missiles to prosecute a grinding war in Ukraine. In October, the partnership entered a new phase as Pyongyang dispatched thousands of soldiers to bolster Russia’s armed forces. Ukrainian and western officials have described their appearance on the battlefield as a major escalation by Moscow. North Korea’s foreign minister promised her country would stick with Russia u
title: Why Thousands of North Koreans Are Fighting in Russia

description: Thaksin Shinawatra, the de facto chief of Thailand’s ruling party, called for tighter regulatory oversight, better corporate governance and tax incentives for long-term equity investors to revive confidence in the country’s stock market.
title: Thaksin Outlines Steps to Revive Flagging Thai Stock Market

description: An operation to rescue illegal gold miners who are stranded in deep underground shafts in South Africa’s North West province got under way on Monday, ending a months-long standoff over their fate.
title: South Africa Starts Rescuing Illegal Gold Miners Trapped for Months

description: Lebanese diplomat Nawaf Salam, a former United Nations envoy and current head of the International Court of Justice, has secured the required votes needed to become prime minister of the country.
title: Lebanese Diplomat Secures Majority Vote for Prime Minister Role

description: Up and down Toronto’s Bay Street, investors and strategists are rewriting the playbook for Canadian stocks. The reason, naturally, is Donald Trump.
title: Political Turmoil Sends Canadian Traders Back to Drawing Board

description: Zimbabwe’s main opposition party said it won’t stand in the way of calls for President Emmerson Mnangagwa to extend his tenure an extra two years, until 2030.
title: Zimbabwe Opposition Won’t Block Bid to Extend President’s Term

description: Mozambican lawmakers elected Margarida Talapa as the new parliamentary speaker on Monday as opposition parties snubbed the ceremony in protest of the disputed October elections.
title: Mozambique Lawmakers Elect Talapa New Speaker as Protests Resume

description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said he has “full confidence” in Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves and stressed that his government would stick to its fiscal rules in response to a surge in UK borrowing costs.
title: Starmer Has ‘Full Confidence’ in Reeves, Stresses Fiscal Rules

description: Germany’s far-right AfD party warned it would dismantle wind parks should it win power, triggering a scathing response from the country’s energy industry.
title: German Far-Right Aligns With Trump on Takedown of Wind Energy

description: A South African antitrust regulator recommended that African Rainbow Capital, backed by billionaire Patrice Motsepe, divest from one of the country’s largest fresh agricultural produce agencies, because it is impeding competition.
title: Tycoon-Backed Firm Urged to Sell South African Fresh Food Unit

description: Israel raised a record amount of debt last year to fund its multi-front war against Hamas and other Iran-backed militias.
title: Israel Raised Record Amount of Bonds Last Year to Pay for War

description: Rachel Reeves is safe in her position as Chancellor of the Exchequer, one of the most senior members of Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s cabinet said, after the market turmoil that hit UK assets in recent days raised questions about the future of Britain’s finance minister.
title: Rachel Reeves’ Position as Chancellor is Safe, UK Cabinet Minister Says

description: Talks between Israeli and Hamas envoys to pause the 15-month war in Gaza are making progress, with negotiations underway to release hostages in exchange for Palestinian prisoners and deliver a boost to humanitarian aid.
title: Gaza Ceasefire Talks Make Progress Ahead of Trump Inauguration

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump Stalks Germany’s Postwar Politics

description: The Andean nation must bring in cargoes with a bigger carbon footprint as its own reserves dwindle and its president refuses to allow new drilling contracts.
title: Colombia’s Bold Push to Go Green Has an Unintended Trade Off: Gas Imports

description: Austrian negotiators trying to form a nationalist-conservative government will target €6.3 billion ($6.4 billion) in immediate budget spending cuts to avoid being reprimanded by the European Union.
title: Austria Far-Right Eyes €6.3 Billion Budget Cut to Avoid EU Probe

description: The UK and Mauritius said they’ve made ‘good progress’ in a round of talks to settle the sovereignty of the Chagos archipelago in the Indian Ocean, including the stewardship of a key US-British military base.
title: UK, Mauritius Say ‘Good Progress’ Made in Chagos Talks

description: Thailand said foreign and domestic companies pledged to invest 1.14 trillion baht ($33 billion) last year as the Southeast Asian nation emerged as a hot destination for data centers, cloud services and advanced electronics manufacturing.
title: Thailand Says Investment Plans Soar to a Decade-High $33 Billion

description: Vietnam overtook Japan as China’s third-largest export destination for the first time, as US tariffs force companies to find new suppliers to avoid levies while continuing to rely on Chinese manufacturers for components.
title: China Exports More to Vietnam Than Japan for First Time as Supply Chains Shift

description: Malaysia’s government is seeking to prevent public discourse on jailed former Prime Minister Najib Razak’s bid for house arrest, a week after his court victory led to political unease.
title: Malaysia Government to Seek Gag Order on Najib House Arrest Bid

description: Thailand’s cabinet approved in principle a bill seeking to legalize casinos with the government pitching the initiative as a major step to boost tourism and tackle rampant illegal gambling in the Southeast Asian nation.
title: Thai Cabinet Gives Conditional Nod for Bill to Legalize Casinos

description: The Philippines on Monday said it filed a diplomatic protest to counter China’s “continued illegal presence and activities” within Manila’s exclusive economic zone in the South China Sea.
title: Philippines Protests ‘Illegal’ Presence of China Ships, Chopper

description: Outgoing Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin recommended the US government boost defense spending by about $50 billion more than projected in fiscal year 2026 with increases that would push the Pentagon budget past $1 trillion in the years to come.
title: Austin Tells OMB $926 Billion Defense Budget Needed, $55 Billion over Current Plan

description: The UK’s trade in goods is set to grow by an average of just 0.7% a year in the decade from 2023, well behind the global average of 2.9%, according to a report published Monday by Boston Consulting Group.
title: Trump and Ongoing Brexit Troubles Combine to Threaten UK Trade

description: His focus on Canada, Greenland and Panama looks a lot like Russia’s approach to its “near abroad.”
title: What If Trump Were to Rule Like Putin?

description: Loss of Russian pipeline supplies will stoke demand for LNG and could squeeze out poorer emerging nations.
title: Europe Threatens to Trigger a Global Scramble for Natural Gas

description: The energy market is no longer a constraint on American foreign policy in the Middle East.
title: US Reliance on Saudi Oil Is Nearing Its Endgame

description: More than one million supporters of Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte rallied in the capital on Monday, a show of force that may pressure lawmakers to reject an impeachment motion against her.
title: Church Rally Backing Embattled Duterte Draws More Than a Million

description: A liquefied natural gas tanker carrying a shipment from a Russian plant sanctioned by Washington on Friday is poised to be the first to test buyers’ willingness to circumvent the latest round of punitive measures.
title: Russian LNG Cargo Near Spain to Test Impact of Latest Sanctions

description: The US secured ties with key Asian allies Japan and the Philippines ahead of Donald Trump’s return to the White House, with President Joe Biden expressing optimism that a trilateral alliance will continue.
title: US Secures Ties With Japan, Philippines Ahead of Trump Return

description: Ukraine is ready to return captured North Korean soldiers if leader Kim Jong Un can facilitate an exchange for Ukrainian soldiers being held in Russia, according to President Volodymyr Zelenskiy.
title: Zelenskiy Seeks to Exchange North Korean Soldiers for Ukrainians

description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves returns to the UK from China on Monday with the Labour Party keen to brush off market turmoil around its fiscal difficulties and emphasize the government’s long-term ambitions.
title: Reeves Returns From China Amid Calls to Confront UK’s Gilt Woes

description: Billed as the world’s largest human gathering, India hosts a once-in-a-decade religious event from Monday that gives Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s party a fresh opportunity to promote its Hindu nationalist agenda among hundreds of millions of pilgrims.
title: The World’s Largest Human Gathering Is About to Begin In India
